Key Match Events: Malik Monk led the way with a game-high 31 points.
Jaylen Wells scored a career-high 30 points for Memphis.
The Kings made 21 three-pointers in the game.
De'Aaron Fox was assessed a Flagrant 1 foul.
Jaren Jackson Jr. was ejected after a flagrant foul on De'Aaron Fox.
DeMar DeRozan hit a season-high 4 three-pointers on 7 attempts.
DeMar DeRozan closed the game with a driving reverse dunk on Jake LaRavia.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Doug Christie mentioned that he wanted the Kings to shoot at least 40 threes a game.
The Kings will look to extend their winning streak on Sunday against the Golden State Warriors.
The game was described as fun and energetic, with the Kings playing with joy and leaning into their strengths.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Devin Carter made his debut with 0 points, 5 rebounds, 2 assists, and 2 fouls in 10:48 minutes.
Trey Lyles was perfect from the floor with 16 points on 6-6 from the field and 4-4 from three.
The Kings were without Keegan Murray and opted for a smaller but quicker lineup.
The Kings' offense was compared to their first Beam Team year.
Memphis was getting to the line more frequently and outrebounded the Kings 15 to 7 in the second quarter.
